events.text: [color=#ffed29](Another day closer to approval!)
Still no sprouts, huh? Oh, well.
We got time! And we’ll try different fruits and veggies to see what clicks with you!
Wish [b]Remedium[/b] luck!
[i]smile

“I am proud of you. All of you.”
[color=#ffed29](No matter what people say, I can remember that Mister Avidine is proud of me.)
[color=#ffed29](Time to make the bosses proud.)
“But you are no ordinary man.”

[color=#ffed29](No, sir, I am not!)
[color=#ffed29](Because I’m going to be the best worker in the factory!)
“You are the tallest of men.”
Chills, man! Every time, chills.
[color=#ffed29](Never gets old.)
[color=#ffed29](Even though the streets are the same, somehow, everything seems brighter.)
[color=#ffed29](And there’s the ABP.)
[color=#ffed29](They’re good people, but I should probably hang with the team more.)
[color=#ffed29](Plus, I’ve never been to the Tavern before.)
[color=#ffed29](So many exciting new things.)
[color=#ffed29](Looks like I beat Mrs. Langtree again!)
[color=#ffed29](I wonder how long she’ll take this time.)
[color=#ffed29](Wow, she’s never been this late.)
[color=#ffed29](Maybe she’s sick? I guess I’ll be waiting for Herb today.)
[color=#ffed29](Dang, I’m getting sleepy.)
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]...zzz...
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]...zzz...
Orocho!

The young Orocho!
What are you doing napping in this weather outdoors!
Were your living accommodations so insufficient that you attempted to shelter at the factory?

Oh! No, Miss Odiche, I usually come in early and Mrs. Langtree lets me in.
But I guess she’s not coming?
Is she sick?
Regrettably, Sage quit yesterday.
WHAT???
Indeed, quite the loss. I am surprised she neglected to inform even you?
She was quite fond of you…
That’s cold, Mrs. Langtree…
Perhaps she did not wish to upset you.
I’m upset now, though!

Indeed, as am I.
Quite the disappointment. She devoted herself so dutifully for all those years!
Strong, competent, helpful to the newer employees, enjoyable company—she was honorable until now…

events.question: How could she leave at our zenith?

events.text: How could she abandon us at this critical point in the project?!

Truly!
Now is not the time to be throwing in the towel!
We need her…and the city needs us!

Indeed, for a higher cause, we all must rise!
To think that Sage has failed us and those around her in such a way…
What am I to do without you, Sage…
I guess we have to work even harder?

Indeed! Not even Sage can alter the course of our victory!
We mustn’t mourn, we must push forward!

Yes, ma’am!
Maybe she’ll come back once she sees our product distributed and doing well!
Orocho, you are too correct!

Indeed, it is FOR Sage that we must venture forward!
She has faltered, and we will bring her back to our side.
No time to waste, then!
Truly! Let us start the day!
How could she betray us like this?!

INDEED!
Dear Orocho, the sting of treachery is deep!
I thought we were all on the same page…what is she thinking???

Decades of friendship dashed! For impulsivity and foolishness!
My anger runs deep, Sage! This will not be forgotten!
To be tossed aside, for all of our time together to be discarded…
I trusted her!

As we all did! I most of all, the most foolish…
for trusting her the deepest.
Well, we gotta prove her wrong!
We’ll press forward and [b]Remedium[/b] will be made, with or without her!
We have to! Otherwise, Mrs. Langtree will have been right in leaving!
And this MUST NOT BE SO!

We’ll show her! We’ll show those apothecaries!
We’ll show everyone who doubted us!

We will show her our might!!!
Forward, Orocho! We shall not fail!

events.choice: I’m more upset she didn’t tell me…

events.text: I just wish she told me…
It was a bitter pill to swallow, even as someone who was told!

But still…
I thought she trusted me, I thought we were friends…

Indeed, I, too, thought we were friends…
How she could leave without two weeks notice felt like an insult to those years of friendship.

events.question: [color=#ffed29](I don’t know if I’ve ever heard Miss Odiche use the word “friend” before?)

events.text: Miss Odiche?
Yes, Orocho?
I think…more than the two weeks notice, you’re upset that Mrs. Langtree would choose to leave.
Yes! I am upset she would endanger the project in its critical state!
I think you’re going to miss her.
She’s treacherous…

She was your friend for decades, and it’s sad that she’s leaving without letting you know earlier.
This blindsided you.
Sage, how could you?

You were so close to reaching the 45 year bonus and raise, too.
I don’t understand. For what reason?
[i]sniff
…When did we become so far apart, that I should not even know you were so dissatisfied you would quit…
Let’s go inside, Miss Odiche.
Yes, thank you, Orvo.
You guys were friends?

Yes! Of course!
Why else would she use “Willamina” so freely despite my position over her?
[color=#ffed29](I’ve never thought of that.)
I guess that makes sense. You guys have been working together for a long time, right?
Indeed, she came in several years before I.

Young and inefficient I was, but she was always so strong.
She has always been so giving to people younger than her—that’s never changed about Sage.
Her wedding was beautiful, I helped watch her kids when they were young.
She helped me with my ailing mother.

And then…
It stopped.
Can I ask why?

You can, but even I am uncertain of why.
I cannot blame her, and I am unsure if she blames me. It was slow, gradual, and this was the conclusive end.
Perhaps from the start.
I became my career, and she never would surrender herself like that.
In fact, I think my dedication hardened her against it.
…truly unfortunate.

I’ll miss her, too... 
But you can visit her outside of work?
…I haven’t been to her home in quite some time.
Never too late.

I will consider this. What would be an appropriate gift to bring?
A fruit basket? Perhaps chocolate covered, especially since Sage does like chocolate.
Let’s talk about it inside?
Indeed, we must!

events.choice: What are we going to do without her…

events.text:
What are we going to do without her…
I can’t imagine the factory without her.
[i]sob
Miss Odiche??? Are you okay?!

I’ve never worked here without Sage! For all my years here, she has been here with me!
Coached me, reassured me, comforted me.
Sage was always the one I relied on.

What am I going to do without her here…
Indeed, Orven, what is the Avidine factory without her…
How could she betray me like this?!

events.question: [color=#ffed29](I didn’t realize Miss Odiche cared so much about Mrs. Langtree.)

events.choice: I’m sure this was a huge shock.

events.text: I’m sure you’re even more surprised than I am…

Blindsided!
[i]sniff

Sage always complained about her station but I never knew she meant it when she said she wanted to find someplace different.
Was this not familiar and comforting? Was I not?
Decades of friendship…
What happened to it, Sage?

When did we become so distant that you would only tell me of your resignation the day of?!
The insult!
It hurts.

Deeply!!!
[i]sniff

Oh, Orvo, I do apologize, this is highly unprofessional.
I am sorry to be in such a state.
No, it’s fine, Miss Odiche—I’m sad and I only knew her for a month.
You’ve known her for decades.
I’ll miss her, too.
Let’s go inside, Miss Odiche.
Yes, inside the factory. Let’s go.

events.choice: I didn’t realize you guys were close?

events.text: I didn’t realize you guys were so close?

Yes! Of course!
Why else would she use “Willamina” so freely despite my position over her?
[color=#ffed29](I’ve never thought of that.)
I guess that makes sense. You guys have been working together for a long time, right?

[i]sniff
She came in several years before I. So truly, I have never worked here without her.

Young and inefficient I was, but she was always so strong.
She has always been so giving to people younger than her—that’s never changed about Sage.
Her wedding, her children… all beautiful.

She was beside me when I buried my mother.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]Even when my own sister was not!!!
[i]sob
And to think now she would not even warn me of her resignation.
Not as her manager, but as her friend!

When did we become so distant, Sage…
Was it when I became manager? You had your family, and I only this job…
What was I to do???
[i]sob

…...
I’ll miss her, too.

…But you can go see her out of work!
I think she’d want to know how upset this made you.

…...
…I haven’t been to her home in quite some time.
Never too late.

I will consider this. What would be an appropriate gift to bring?
A fruit basket? Perhaps chocolate covered, especially since Sage does like chocolate.
Let’s talk about it inside?
Indeed, we must!
ORVEN!!!

Yo, Herb!
You excited? I sure am.

Dude, no.
Did you see the police tape around the church???

What?
No, what happened to the church?
People think there’s been
[b]a murder.
Do you think this will affect [b]Remedium[/b]?

??????
What are you talking about, man?
I’m going to call my mom and brothers, make sure they know and are all safe.

You watch out for yourself!!!
Don’t worry about that, we might have a serial killer amongst us?!

events.choice: I mean…does it make a difference?

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Serial killer or not, that doesn’t change what I have to do here, right?)
[color=#ffed29](I mean…even if there is a serial killer, what can I do about it?)
[color=#ffed29](I should get to work.)

Compatriots! Do not let fear strike your heart!
Find peace and safety in the Avidine Factory. We must muster ourselves against these foes!
Many obstacles obscure the finish line, but know we are running the good race.
Together, we must astound everyone around us!
Devote yourselves to [b]Remedium[/b] and its production: that is what it takes to make our dream come true!
I am happy.

That day, a lot of things happened…but people seem to think Mister Avidine is dead?
Which can’t be the case.
Miss Odiche and I are certain of that much.
Someone like him can’t die.
So Miss Odiche and I are waiting for things to turn up.
Because no matter what happens or who else gives up, we know that we aren’t ordinary.
The tallest of men are waiting for their leader.
You got: the Mindless Ending.
ORVEN!!!
Yo, Herb! You okay?

Dude, no.
Did you see the police tape around the church???

What?
No, what happened to the church?
People think there’s been
[b]a murder.

Murder?!
Do you know who? Or if the killer was caught???
I’m going to call my mom and brothers, make sure they know, and are all safe.
You watch out for yourself!!! We might have a serial killer.

…...
[color=#ffed29](The [b]Devil's Lung[/b] and now a murderer? What are we going to do?)
Excuse me.
My name is Detective Gou, and I work for the Ventreville police force.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][color=#ffed29](DOES SHE THINK I’M THE MURDERER???)
Please come with me. We are interviewing all the employees of the Avidine Factory.

Uh, yes, ma’am!
I don’t want any trouble.
…do you know the reasoning as to why we are interviewing Avidine workers?

??????
No? But if you’re telling me to go with you, I will.
We are investigating the murder of Retter and Flaire Avidine.
What.

After the murder of Ret and Flaire Avidine, the Avidine Factory was shut down and gutted to pay back investors.
All employees were taken for questioning, wth some being detained as the police continue to search for decisive evidence.
The Avidine children, Lunette and Matty: without any known next of kin, their future has yet to be determined.
Ventreville, shaken by the murder of the beloved couple and left without a hope of a cure, cried out in anguish and fear.

Orven Zanry, after questioning, refused to return to Germanon. Clinging to the remains of the closed factory, he mourns.  
His Gramma would then travel to Ventreville to pick him up and drag him back to Germanon.
Orven Zanry has yet to recover from his time and choices in Ventreville.
You got: the Curiosity Killed the Cat Ending.
